author: MIKE MAZZEO
title: Mitt Romney & son looking to buy a small piece of Yankees: report
text:
02 PM 
The Yankees could be adding a former Republican presidential nominee to their ownership group. 
Mitt Romney and his family are interested in purchasing a small stake in the Yankees, according to Jon Heyman of FanRag Sports. 
According to Heyman, one percent of the Yankees could be worth $30 million based on a $3 billion valuation of the franchise, which could be a conservative estimate. 
Romney, the Bain Capital co-founder and former Massachusetts governor, lost to Barack Obama in the 2012 presidential election. 
The 69-year-old Romney, along with his son Tagg, reportedly had offered $1.4 billion to buy the Miami Marlins.
